newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian industry supports labour reform.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian industry supports labour reform.

text.p: Australia's key industry groups said on Monday they would urge the parliament's upper house, the Senate, to pass the government's proposed labour market changes.
"Peak industry leaders met in Canberra today and unanimously adopted a resolution urging the Senate to pass the Workplace Relations Bill as soon as possible," they said in a statement.

"The group said the unified support of Australia's major business and employer groups for a bill to reform the Australian labour market was of paramount importance," they said after meeting Prime Minister John Howard and Opposition Leader Kim Beazley.

The Liberal-National government plans to increase flexibility in the labour market, downgrading the role of unions and industrial tribunals, and making it easier for employers and employees to make their own arrangements.
The groups said they had also presented their resolution to minor party, the Australian Democrats.
The government needs the support of at least two non-government senators to pass legislation in the upper house.
The Labor Opposition, the minor parties and two Independents can supply those votes.
